body_html: My bad, I didn't read the np docs carefully enough. So numpy.transpose is equivalent (or very similar to) torch.permute, and torch.transpose is equivalent to numpy.swapaxes. In this case I'm not sure if it's worth matching the numpy API because the functionality is there but we might confuse our existing users.
body_text: My bad, I didn't read the np docs carefully enough. So numpy.transpose is equivalent (or very similar to) torch.permute, and torch.transpose is equivalent to numpy.swapaxes. In this case I'm not sure if it's worth matching the numpy API because the functionality is there but we might confuse our existing users.
body: My bad, I didn't read the np docs carefully enough. So `numpy.transpose` is equivalent (or very similar to) `torch.permute`, and `torch.transpose` is equivalent to `numpy.swapaxes`. In this case I'm not sure if it's worth matching the numpy API because the functionality is there but we might confuse our existing users.
